page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Roydon Manor House was the Dower House of the Brockenhurst Manor Estate. The Brockenhurst Manor House itself stood in Brockenhurst Park from the middle 18th Century until it was demolished in 1958 to be replaced by a modern building in 1962. The owner of Roydon Manor House is Mr E.J.F.Morant whose family have been Lords of the Manor of Brockenhurst (and of Ringwood) since l770. The Brockenhurst Park estate was sold by the Morant family in l959. The farm attached to Roydon comprises 280 acres and a further 170acres in the adjacent parish of Boldre is rented. 90 head of beef cattle are kept for which the principal buyer is the local butcher. The wheat and barley grown is chiefly exported through the new grain dock at Southampton.
